The MpABI1 cDNA encoded a 568-amino acid protein consisting of the carboxy-terminal protein phosphatase 2C (PP2C) domain and a novel amino-terminal regulatory domain. The MpABI1 transcript was detected in the gametophyte, and its expression level was increased by exogenous ABA treatment in the gemma, whose growth was strongly inhibited by Abscisic acid (ABA).
reference: Tougane et al. Plant Physiol. 2010 152:1529-43. PMID: 20097789

product: Transcriptiion factor, similarity to Arabidopsis activator ARFs.
description: The M. polymorpha genome encodes three ARFs (MpARF1, MpARF2, and MpARF3). The three MpARFs have a structure common to typical ARFs, containing a B3-like DNA binding domain (DBD) and a protein-protein interaction motif, called domains III and IV (Figs 1A and S2). Between the DBD and domain III, MpARF1 harbors a glutamine-rich region, which is known as a feature of activator ARF members. Phylogenetic analysis showed that MpARF1 belonged to the clade A, which represents activator ARF proteins such as ARF5/MONOPTEROS (MP) of Arabidopsis.
reference: Kato et al., PLOS Genet. 11, e1005084 (2015) PMID: 26020919; Flores-Sandval et al., PLOS Genet. 11, e1005207 (2015). PMID: 26020649

product: Transcriptiion factor, similarity to Arabidopsis repressor ARFs.
description: MpARF2 resided in clade B, and was shown to function as transcriptional repressor.
reference: Kato et al., PLOS Genet. 11, e1005084 (2015) PMID: 26020919; Flores-Sandval et al., PLOS Genet. 11, e1005207 (2015). PMID: 26020649

product: Transcriptiion factor, similarity to Arabidopsis repressor ARFs.
description: MpARF3 has a relatively longer DBD, and its domains III and IV show lower similarity to ARFs in the clades A and B. MpARF3 mRNA contains the possible target sequence of microRNA160. These features are common with Arabidopsis ARF10 and ARF16, which possibly function as repressors. Phylogenetic analysis supported the placement of MpARF3 in the clade C including Arabidopsis ARF10, ARF16, and ARF17.
reference: Kato et al., PLOS Genet. 11, e1005084 (2015) PMID: 26020919; Flores-Sandval et al., PLOS Genet. 11, e1005207 (2015). PMID: 26020649

description: Knockout of MpFKF completely abolishes the long-day-dependent growth-phase transition in M. polymorpha. Overexpression of MpFKF promotes growth-phase transition under short-day conditions.
reference: Kubota et al. Nat Commun. 5:3668 (2014).

description: GCAM1 gene is transcriptionally upregulated in gemma-cups and developing gemma comparing to the other parts of thallus.

Knockout of either the GIGANTEA(GI) or FLAVIN-BINDING KELCH REPEAT F-BOX1 (FKF1) orthologue completely abolishes the long-day-dependent growth-phase transition in M. polymorpha. Overexpression of either gene promotes growth-phase transition, even under short-day conditions. Introduction of the GI orthologue partially rescues the late-flowering phenotype of the Arabidopsis thaliana gi mutant.
reference: Kubota et al. Nat. Commun. 5:3668 (2014).

product: Plant U-box E3 Ubiquitin Ligase NOP1
description: NOP1 has an essential role in schizogenous intercellular space formation in Marchantia polymorpha.NOP1 encodes a Plant U-box (PUB) E3 ubiquitin ligase carrying tandem ARMADILLO (ARM) repeats in the C terminus. An in vitro ubiquitination assay indicated that the NOP1 protein possesses E3 ubiquitin ligase activity in a U-box-dependent manner. Confocal microscopy and biochemical analysis showed that NOP1 was localized to the plasma membrane.
reference: Ishizaki and Mizutani et al, Plant Cell 25, 4075-4084 (2013).

description: Description=The plant-specific kinase phototropin (phot) is the blue-light receptor for chloroplast movements. The M. polymorpha genome encodes a single PHOT gene, MpPHOT, and its knockout line displayed none of the chloroplast photorelocation movements. Mpphot protein was localized on the plasma membrane and exhibited blue-light-dependent autophosphorylation both in vitro and in vivo.
reference: Komatsu et al., Plant Physiol. 166, 411-427 (2014). PMID: 25096976
Nishihama et al. J. Plant Res. 128:407-421 (2015).; Inoue et al. Plant Cell 28:1406-1421 (2016).

product: phytochrome interacting bHLH transcription factor, PIF
description: Marchantia polymorpha has only one phytochrome gene, MpPHY, and only one PIF gene, MpPIF. These genes mediate typical low fluence responses, which are reversibly elicited by R and FR, and regulate gene expression.
reference: Inoue et al., Plant Cell 28, 1406-1421 (2016).

description: RSL) class I basic helix-loop-helix transcription factor positively regulates the development of the unicellular and multicellular structures that develop from individual cells that expand out of the epidermal plane of the liverwort Marchantia polymorpha; mutants that lack MpRSL1 function do not develop rhizoids, slime papillae, mucilage papillae, or gemmae.
reference: Proust et al. Cur. Biol. 26(1):93-99 (2016)

full_name: Plastid-encoded plastid RNA polymerase sigma factor 1
description: The T-DNA inserted mutant (Mpsig1) shows no visible phenotypes, however, the transcript accumulation of petL, psaA, psbB, psbK, and psbE operons is downregulated in the mutant. Although MpSIG1 and MpSIG2 redundantly function, MpSIG1 overexpression drastically up-regulates the ndhF transcript level. Citrine fused with the amino terminal sequence of MpSIG1 is transferred to chloroplasts. MpSIG1 transcript is induced by light illumination.
reference: Ueda et al., Genome Biol. Evol. 5, 1836-1848 (2013). PMID: 24025801; Kanazawa et al., Plant Cell Physiol. 54, 1736-1748 (2013). PMID: 23975891

full_name: Plastid-encoded plastid RNA polymerase sigma factor 2
description: MpSIG2 overexpression has an effect similar to that of MpSIG1 overexpression on the transcript levels of chloroplast genes. Citrine fused with the amino terminal sequence of MpSIG2 is transferred to chloroplasts. MpSIG2 transcript is induced by dark shift and decreased by light illumination.
reference: Ueda et al., Genome Biol. Evol. 5, 1836-1848 (2013). PMID: 24025801; Kanazawa et al., Plant Cell Physiol. 54, 1736-1748 (2013). PMID: 23975891

full_name: Plastid-encoded plastid RNA polymerase sigma factor 5
description: Citrine fused with the amino terminal sequence of MpSIG5 is transferred to chloroplasts. MpSIG5 transcript is decreased by dark shift, and transiently induced by light illumination, especially blue-light irradiation. Various environmental stresses such as high light, low temperature, high osmolarity, high saline, and ROS, transiently induce MpSIG5 transcript. SIG5 genes are conserved among embryophyte and a part of charophytes including Klebsormidium flaccidum.
reference: Ueda et al., Genome Biol. Evol. 5, 1836-1848 (2013). PMID: 24025801; Kanazawa et al., Plant Cell Physiol. 54, 1736-1748 (2013). PMID: 23975891

full_name: Plastid-encoded plastid RNA polymerase sigma factor X
product: Similar gene of Arabidopsis plastid RNA polymerase sigma factor genes
description: Citrine fused with the amino terminal sequence of MpSIGX is transferred to chloroplasts. MpSIGX transcript is induced by light illumination. The gene has low similarity compared with other SIG genes of embryophyte, suggesting that MpSIGX might specifically function in the liverwort.
reference: Kanazawa et al., Plant Cell Physiol. 54, 1736-1748 (2013). PMID: 23975891

description: To analyze microtubule function and cell division in Marchantia, the expression of four MpTUBs was compared and TUB1 was found to be most uniformly expressed in Marchantia polymorpha tissues. The live-cell microtubule marker MpTUB1-GFP was generated, which is expressed under the control of the MpEF1a promoter. The observed intimate cooperation of Marchantia polar organizers comprising TUB1 with preprophase bands provides insight into the evolution of division plane alignment control of land plants.
reference: Buschmann et al., New Phytologist 209, 999-1013 (2016).
